4. There's good reason to believe the COVID-19 pandemic will last till at least early 2021 in Sweden's case. There are countries that have gone for a complete shutdown. Since different countries have taken different approaches to COVID-19, this pandemic could last till 2022.

3. Even if we develop a vaccine against COVID-19, we need to take it regularly because there's a likelihood that the immunity we acquire from a COVID-19 infection wouldn't last for too long.

In other words, with some exceptions, a vaccine for COVID-19 is as good as useless.

Personal notes:

1. Given how SARS-CoV-2 spreads rapidly, and the fact that we still don't know for how long our acquired immunity after COVID-19 infection lasts, it's not hard to believe COVID-19 could become seasonal or 2nd/3rd/4th waves are just a matter of time.

4. These antibodies are initially not too good at fighting SARS-CoV-2, but as time goes by, they become better.

Tests on COVID-19 patients pick up antibodies, 10 days after symptoms begin. For many viruses, this is good enough to prevent us from getting sick again. https://t.co/TrUmXjccMF

Acquired immunity to COVID-19 may not be permanent. But once attained, COVID-19 will be more manageable in the future.

In which case, a vaccine, even if possible, won't work forever.
